  • You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the best way to develop, integrate, and deploy the RAN automation in a commercial network
  • You will estimate scope of work required to implement the necessary architectures in order to support technical leads in the development of unified and reliable delivery plans

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • 8 or more years of experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) design and development; familiar with associated 3GPP standards;
  • 3 or more years of experiences with telecommunication operation support system (OSS) development, maintenance or support. Familiar with telecommunication network protocols such as RESTful, NETCONF, TCP/IP, UDP, etc.
  • 2 or more years of working experience on 5G wireless air interfaces technologies, including FDD/TDD Massive MIMO, CA (Carrier aggregation) and CoMP etc.
  • Familiar with Telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Knowledgeable in one or more programming / scripting languages (Python, GO, XML, Java, YAML, Shell, JSON etc.)
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures

item.title: Sr Systems Analyst
item.description:
Join our team


Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 
Our World Class Assurance team is responsible for transforming event management functions and providing high quality data for faster decision making.  Leveraging AI and automation to improve correlation along multiple dimensions in order to achieve intelligent alarming and root cause determination, allows for improved response times and creates operational efficiencies.
 
Do you want to transform the monitoring and reliability experience within TELUS, while working with the latest technologies? If so, this is the role for you!
 
As the Sr. Systems Analyst within the Reliability Centre of Excellence team, you will enable operational monitoring and correlation to allow internal TELUS users to manage customer service dependent systems and networks, while supporting agile DevOps teams to make use of automation, evolved troubleshooting, and self-serve monitoring.

 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 
You are a Subject Matter Expert – someone who brings your strong technical skillset with a knack for pushing the innovation boundaries. You will be part of an industry leading team that delivers world class assurance solutions. Partnering with senior architects, developers, stakeholders, and senior leaders, you will drive key strategic and transformation initiatives.


 
Here\'s how
 

  • You have a proven track record and ability to translate business requirements, network strategies and architectures into reliable, scalable solutions
  • You are known for your ability to liaise with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, always focused on the end goal of building efficient, working systems
  • You are respected for your ability to see the big and long-term picture, thinking strategically when it comes to fixing technical issues, avoiding band aid solutions, and focusing on long-term strategic solutions
  • You collaborate with business analysts and network and enterprise architects to ensure consistent, achievable solutions that are aligned with the strategic objectives
  • You specify reusable technical architecture components to reduce development and support costs
  • You perform data design and management activities for development work
  • You are sought out for your knowledge and deep understanding of Wireline & Wireless technologies and protocols (GPON, XGSPON, Voice over Fiberized Gateway, 5G, 5G Cloud, LTE, WiFi, IOT,  etc)
  • You have good knowledge Open Source Cloud Computing Infrastructure OpenStack, Red Hat OpenShift
  • You are the go-to person when it comes to understanding project governance and change management

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You have 7+ years of hands-on work experience in a relevant field.
  • You hold a university degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • You bring strong business acumen with experience in business case and project based Economic Analysis modelling
  • You bring an understanding of applications and Operating systems that include Linux, HP-UX, AIX and networks in general, conversant with protocols and Distributed System Architectures such as XML, WebServices, SOA, ESB’s, SNMP v2c and v3, UPD, TCP etc.
  • You have strong knowledge of Watson AIOps, ICAM, Netcool Omnibus, IBM’s ITNM & ASM software, IBM’s Predictive Insights, Ansible Playbooks, PERL, JAVA, Shell Scripting
  • You have demonstrated leadership skills, being able to work directly with management teams and formulate strategic plans
  • You can easily explain complex and layered technical matters to non-technical crowds in a way that resonates with them
  • You have strong analytical skills that result in sound decisions
  • You have experience with Unified Modeling Language and tools such as ArchiMate.
  • You have experience with process modelling methodologies, including eTOM and ITIL 
  • You have extensive experience within operational support systems and business operations, especially in one or more of the following: Service Assurance, Service Management/Network monitoring, Configuration Management, Performance Management, Capacity Management, Network Provisioning and Activation, Service Fulfillment and Mediation
     

Great-to-haves
 

  • Knowledge of cloud based solutions (GCP, AWS) and Virtualization platforms (VMWare)
  • Knowledge of Big Data (HDFS, Map/Reduce, Kafka, NiFi, Ambari, Hive, HBase, Spark, Sqoop)
  • Machine Learning/AI experience
  • Deep knowledge of OpenShift templates, buildconfigs, deploymentconfigs, services, routes, configmaps

item.title: Senior Security Consultant - Secure by Design
item.description:
Description

 Join our team

 We live in a fast-paced cyber-world where protecting our information has become paramount. At TELUS Security, we strive to always be steps ahead, tackling the toughest security challenges head-on with top talent and cutting edge technology.
The Secure by Design (SbD) team enables TELUS, at an early stage of its project lifecycle, to build secure solutions by following a secure by design principled approach. We carry out thorough security assessments, identify risks and provide expert consulting by way of security control recommendations to technology and business partners. 
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together  

As a Senior Security Consultant you will leverage your subject matter expertise in the field of cyber security to assess network/system/application design and implementation and offer consultation to enhance security postures. You will partner with IT architects, network engineers, and software developers across Mobility, Cloud, and IoT teams making a difference in protecting the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of TELUS services & information. In this specific role your key areas of focus would be security assessments for both TELUS & TELUS Health.
 

Here\'s How

Perform security threat and risk analysis, network, system and application-level security reviews on a wide variety of TELUS services, acquisitions and even product offerings which include Internet of Things ( IoT), Robotic Process Automations (RPAs) and Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning ( AI and ML) and Cloud. Assess network, system and application designs and implementations with a security lens to discover subtle security issues for unexpected threat scenarios including conducting all of these for TELUS Health systems too. Get the chance to collaborate with and liaise with many stakeholders, from the Privacy team to which you will provide data Subject Matter Expert (SME) recommendations, to project teams, solutions architects and technologists during their design phases to ensure Security is top of mind and up to industry standards.Apply security standards and best practices to recommend solutions for advanced information and network security requirements and plan, research & design information security into networks and systems with hands-on application of technical methods and techniques and policies and procedures.

Design and implement risk driven information and network security solutions and evaluate and design security and controls for new technologies to address such areas as infrastructure, security administration, user identification and authentication, data security, network and host intrusion prevention, detection and monitoring. Assist with and participate in the development of information, system and network protection policies, procedures, strategies and architectures to define and support TELUS’ information and network security programs while educating and coaching peer groups of architects and engineers on how to better design security into their various projects
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • 5+ years cybersecurity experience in Health, Software, Telecom or IT industries
  • Distinguished for your intimate knowledge of information/network security technology, audit and control measures, monitoring/investigation methodologies and privacy/regulatory/criminal legislation
  • Recognized for your advanced knowledge of application security, systems security and network security in emerging technologies
  • Expert in understanding and application of major security standards, guidance, and frameworks based on NIST CSF, HIPAA, ISO/IEC 27000, OWASP, PCI, CIS, etc. to the realities of business and information security
  • Valued for your leadership skills:
  • Ability to influence decisions of peers/teams with technical authority and trust based relationships
  • Ability to technically direct/lead teams
  • Ability to build consensus in team environments and manage conflict while striving for shared goals and objectives
  • Ability to mentor junior team mgembers and aid in their development
  • Ability to make decisions with imperfect information
  • Ability to admit mistakes and bring correction and course change in a timely manner
  • Reasonably skilled in project management and system deployment methodologies
  • Commended for your excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • With a university degree preferably in a technology related field
  • Regarded for one or more security or other applicable certifications such as CISSP; CISA; CISM; CRISC; ISO27000, ITIL
  • The candidate should have or be willing to undergo a Secret II clearance, due to the nature of their employment

Great to haves

  • 2+ years of operational, system administration, or infrastructure build and deployment in a security-focused environment, especially in environments pertaining to processing and storage of Health information (ePHI)
  • Knowledge of Health industry and associated network technologies (5-10 years)
  • Background in IT audit and technical project management (with a strong security component) will also be considered

item.title: Senior Technology Architect - Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team
 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. 
We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
 
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 
 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning Spark applications
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on- technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice to have

 

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

•    Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
•    Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
•    Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
•    Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
•    Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
•    Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
•    Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
•    With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
•    Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
•    Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
•    Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
•    Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
•    Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
•    Solid knowledge and understanding of:
o    Application integration models and methodologies
o    Agile development and DevOps methodologies
o    Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
o    Software development and coding techniques 
o    Cloud native technologies and concepts
•    Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
•    Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
•    Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
•    Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
•    Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
•    Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
•    Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
•    Experience in web/mobile applications development
•    Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team


 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data

 

 

Voici comment

 

  • Concevoir des pipelines de données, fournir l’infrastructure et établir des applications et des services fiables fondés sur les données dans la plateforme Google Cloud
  • Analyser les données, créer des modèles et générer des rapports et des visualisations avec Hadoop et l’infrastructure infonuagique
  • Intégrer les grands ensembles de données issues de multiples sources aux fins de la modélisation des données
  • Cerner et exploiter les occasions d’automatisation dans les processus de développement et de production afin de réduire les tâches manuelles en amont
  • Repérer les problèmes de données qui se répercutent sur les indicateurs d’affaires clés et les communiquer aux équipes de gestion des produits
  • Entretenir les pipelines de données qui alimentent les algorithmes et les modèles d’apprentissage-machine
  • Participer à l’extraction, au chargement, à la transformation, au nettoyage et à la validation des données

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementating and performance tuning Spark
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technolgy, data processing systemsgies (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on-technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice-to-haves

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

item.title: Senior BI Cloud Data Engineer
item.description:
Join our team

 


We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Business Intelligence team in Home Solutions Customer Experience. Our team uses data & analytics to support 15k global team members across a number of internal teams. We use data from over 10 million annual customer interactions to feed our BI & Customer Feedback solutions, and  support informed decision making across our Contact Centre and Field operations teams. You will be at the forefront as we work together to design and build the next generation BI platform based on the Google Cloud Platform using technologies and tools that will include SQL, Python, Bigquery, Looker, and Github.

 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 


Collaborating  with other technical team members, product owners, stakeholders and business leaders you will be part of a team that provides easy access to information for our internal teams. You’ll be a part of the evolution that will replace our existing Microsoft BI based solutions and transform how we use data and analytics at TELUS. This exciting journey will further help us to meet the needs of our customers and enable exceptional team member experiences and outcomes through easy access to data.

 


Here\'s how

 

You will be a valuable member of the team as you:

  • Partner with business primes to understand their business strategy and data goals, then work with them to  propose and implement capabilities that can achieve these outcomes
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance collaborating with other data and analytics professionals to design, build, and manage our data and analytics solutions (pipeline, storage, integration, analytics)
  • Collaborate with vendors and other technical teams across TELUS to ensure that our approach is coordinated and scalable for the future needs of TELUS
  • Be curious, stay current on top developments in cloud technology and machine learning and identify opportunities to use these approaches to drive a data centric culture

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 


Don’t worry if you don’t yet meet every requirement below. We are looking for an experienced team member with a curious and collaborative mindset combined with solid data solution engineering skills.
 
Are recognized for your technical and analytical skills with experience in: 

  • Architecting and implementing next generation data and analytics platforms on Google Cloud Platform 
  • Design and implementing ingestion and curation functions on Google Cloud Platform using GCP native or custom programming 
  • Planning and building semantic layer (business logic) capabilities using Big Query and/or LookML (or equivalent technologies)

 
You have had opportunities to leverage your:

  • Database knowledge and experience with establishing pipelines and data marts across different database platforms
  • Strong understanding of dimensional modeling concepts – facts vs. dimensions, surrogate keys, and data granularity
  • Knowledge of SQL including writing, debugging and tuning T-SQL queries, creating SQL tables, views and stored procedures and a strong understanding of relational databases

 
Known for your ability to bring people together:

  • Mentoring and helping fellow team members develop their technical capabilities and progress in their careers
  • Being comfortable with working within tailored delivery methodologies based on what best suits a project and team (Agile, Kanban etc.)
  • Articulating and communicating technical approaches and information to a business orientated audience

item.title: Sr Technology Cnslt
item.description:
Join our team

Your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in helping TELUS continue to grow its data engineering and analytics practices and develop effective systems and applications. Be part of a supportive culture where the customer is front and center,
motivating us to continuously improve and provide innovative solutions.

Here’s how:

•    Help collect, consolidate, transport and analyze data and communicate alerts related to these 
•    Identify potential process and procedure enhancements, work on bug fixes and functionality gaps
•    Provide companywide technical leadership on multi-functional, complex systems
•    Collaborate and partner with various architecting, DevOps engineering and project management teams and vendors and internal clients
•    Ensure that the offered solutions are stable and reliable and offer the flexibility to promote revenue, meeting customer specific requirements and client business growth within TELUS all while ensuring that it remains best-in-class
•    Provide and implement architecture solutions that meet the team’s and customers’ business requirements

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle:
•    You are able to formulate strategic plans and to present them to senior leadership teams to secure buy-in
•    You are a forward thinker and use your technical expertise to drive business benefits and impact the bottom line
•    You are a relationship builder comfortable liaising with customers for systems, process and procedure improvements
•    You are a technical expert with core elements such as operating systems, databases and networks and knowledgeable of UNIX, Solaris, AIX, Linux and Windows
•    You are sought out for your programming and scripting skills and experience working in a DevOps environment
•    You are a self-directed, self-starting crystal clear communicator whether written or verbal and approach problems with an analytical mindset and problem solving skills
 

Additional factors that make you a great member to our team

•    University degree, ideally in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Java, Python, Perl, Bash and Shell scripting
•    Data Analytics skills and experience
•    Experience with Docker & Swarm
•    Experience using Machine Learning tools

Great to haves:

•    Splunk admin and data onboarding
•    GCP cloud monitoring and logging – Big Query and Cloud Logging
•    NiFi flow development, Kafka
•    Kubernetes (or Openshift)
•    Ansible Playbooks
•    Hadoop and Hive

item.title: Manager, Cross Product Base Management
item.description:
Join our team

 

We are searching for a Manager for a new team within our SMB (Small-Medium Businesses). In this role, you will be responsible for maximizing the value of our current base, by understanding how the business owners we work with make decisions, and creating solutions for them that are beneficial to both the business owners and Telus.
 
The Small-Medium Business (SMB) team is a dynamic, driven, fast-paced, and highly engaged group. Together, the team is responsible for delivering profitable growth within the highest-value segment for TELUS Business. 

 

We are the destination of choice for entrepreneurial marketers that enjoy starting something from nothing and building it up. We have some of the most engaged and collaborative team members at TELUS with values that focus on ownership, outcomes, curiosity, iteration and celebration. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will build and lead a high performing team responsible for driving profitability and revenue growth to support our long term Wireline and Wireless P&L. Your team will be responsible for cross product initiatives, and business owner focused programs to increase retention and ARPU.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Build and execute churn management and proactive retention programs by leveraging data science to target campaign activities, ensuring contained spend and efficient return
  • Create solutions focused on business owners needs
  • Delivering an increase in customer wallet-share (ARPU) through programs that provide customers with more value (upsell, cross-sell, etc.)
  • Act on results and trends: what’s working, what we should be doing differently, pricing and product insights, as well as competitive trends
  • Build and maintain a team culture that leverages data-driven insights for continuous improvement, celebrate wins together, and socialize learnings for future success 
  • This is a new team, you will need to be comfortable creating new processes, recruiting new team members, and while working towards a new vision for how we manage our base. 

    You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

     

    • You\'re a natural born leader with a willingness to challenge the status quo; you\'re able to work collaboratively and confidently with multiple stakeholders across different business units and levels to ensure alignment
    • You excel in a business ownership environment
    • You are curious to develop an understanding for and leverage data-driven insights that result in continuous improvements

  • Build and execute churn management and proactive retention programs by leveraging data science to target campaign activities, ensuring contained spend and efficient return

item.title: Product Designer, Analytics & Data Science
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

The Advanced Analytics team at Oxford Properties Group is looking for a brilliant Product Designer to bring our Analytics and Data Science products to life and provide an outstanding user experience to internal and external audiences.

As a best-in-class real estate organization, Oxford has an ambitious plan to leverage analytics capabilities across the real estate value chain including acquisition, development, operations, and disposition at a global scale.

The Advanced Analytics team works on a wide range of business problems aligned to Oxford’s strategic priorities, from using alternative data to fine-tune investment decisions to crunching operational and smart building data to streamline how we manage our assets and unlock new revenue streams.

Commercial Real Estate is a $200 Trillion industry - larger than the public equities and bond market combined - and yet is only just being disrupted by data and technology. This opens a fantastic opportunity for you to develop thought leadership and champion design practices, transforming how the real estate industry unlocks value from data.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Being part of a highly skilled cross-functional analytics team, reporting to the Senior Director of Advanced Analytics
  • Working closely with our data scientists and data engineers to shape analytics and machine learning (ML) products allowing Oxford to make faster, better data-driven decisions
  • Understanding our business stakeholders across various Oxford teams by running interviews and workshops to gather user feedback on what they care about and what stands in their way
  • Distilling large amounts of insights and complex interactions with data science algorithms into an intuitive, seamless, and delightful user experience for consumers of analytics
  • Building dashboards or web app prototypes to test with users, gathering feedback on what works and where they struggle
  • Improving the user experience in finding the answer to key business questions via analytics
  • Developing a beautiful and consistent look-and-feel for our analytics products
  • Encouraging design thinking amongst our data scientists and data engineers

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • 3-5 years’ experience of working as a Product Designer or equivalent product design portfolio
  • A proven track record of creating brilliant and intuitive products (designing interfaces for data and analytics-driven products a strong plus)
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence both technical and non-data fluent business partners
  • Experience running user research, user testing, and A/B testing
  • Experience creating user personas, user flows, and seamless customer journeys
  • Experience organizing and running design workshops
  • A test and learn approach to design, iterating clickable prototypes quickly based on internal and external feedback
  • Solid working knowledge of design tools (such as Figma or Sketch)

You will stand out if you have:

  • Excellent data visualization skills and working knowledge of data visualization and reporting tools (such as PowerBI or Tableau)
  • A proven ability to distil large volumes of data points, insights, charts, maps, forecasts, and recommendations into an intuitive experience for a non-data fluent audience
  • A high-level understanding or personal passion for data insights, analytics, and data science
  • Experience of working with data teams to design web apps to interface with ML models
  • Experience of designing

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

OMERS Products and Technology is looking for Cloud Data Engineer passionate about all sides of data analytics and eager to build a data platform for our pension Data engineering team. The individual should be extremely motivated and want to constantly learn and apply new technologies. In this role, the qualified candidate is expected to drive actionable insights; transforming, modelling, processing and extracting value from datasets.


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Develop and maintain data pipelines
  • Design and implement ETL processes
  • Hands on experience on Data Modeling – Design conceptual, logical and physical data; experience with Kimball methodology (Data Vault methodology knowledge is a plus)
  • Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows
  • Knowledge to move the ETL code base from On-premise to Cloud Architecture
  • Understanding data lineage and governance for different data sources
  • Maintaining clean and consistent access to all our data sources
  • Hands on experience to deploy the code using CI/CD pipelines
  • Assemble large and complex data sets strategically to meet business requirements
  • Enable business users to bring data-driven insights into their business decisions through reports and dashboards

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Experience with data platform cloud technologies for creating data pipeline (preference Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Server, PowerBI)
  • Experience doing semantic data modeling and publish datasets accordingly
  • Understanding security rules and roles in projects, workspaces in PowerBI 
  • Possess in-depth understanding of SQL, database management systems and ETL (Extract, transform, load) frameworks
  • Experience with SSIS, Informatica ETL, data modelling, data warehousing, and business intelligence architecture
  • Knowledge of programming, scripting (e.g. SQL, PowerShell, Python, C#, Power Query, DAX
  • Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates
  • Proven track record of learning new technologies quickly
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field
  • Experience building data visualizations, preferably Power BI
  • 10 years of experience working with data

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Senior BI & Data Analyst
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Why Join Us?


The Senior BI & Data Analyst, Global Investments Technology (GIT) will join a team that leads the delivery of the products and platforms that enable OMERS Global Investments (GI) to analyze opportunities, action investment decisions and optimize the OMERS investment portfolio. GIT works across investment teams including Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Private Equity, Growth Equity and Ventures, and in close collaboration with Finance, Risk & Compliance teams.

As a key member of the Global Investments Technology team, the Senior Data Analyst is instrumental in enhancing data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering high quality datasets, reports, and training to enhance business decision making.

The Senior BI & Data Analyst will develop Power BI datasets and reports to support OMERS investment entities, maintain a healthy business relationship to assist in meeting business demands and deliver training workshops to promote a data culture. The Senior BI & Data Analyst will also support and collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and knowledge sharing through the implementation as part of 1 or more product team(s).

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Technical

  • Organizing workshops with partners to gather requirements and develop low/high fidelity wireframes
  • Developing and monitoring Power BI Premium Dataflows to gather, transform and democratize structured and unstructured data assets
  • Developing Power BI datasets by applying best-practice semantic modeling techniques
  • Building visually stunning reports that clearly communicate an effective story
  • Leading solution build, delivery, support and troubleshooting
  • Provisioning and managing resources of Premium Capacity
  • Managing the Power BI / Power Platform infrastructure
  • Usage Monitoring and Auditing

Organizational

  • Operating in an Agile development environment
  • Communicating effectively with analysts and various partners across multiple teams and with various other partners such as product managers, data engineers and members of senior management
  • Managing change and communicating impacts to partners and fellow team members
  • Facilitating collaboration and sharing through best practices of delivering and sharing content
  • Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for improving existing processes
  • Exhibiting the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensuring timely delivery
  • Leading the Power BI Community of Interest to review the latest features and updates
  • Collaborating with other teams and establishing Power Platform Governance and Support

To succeed in this role, you have:

Professional

  • Experience. 5+ years solving complex technical projects as a full-stack (M & DAX) Power BI developer
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific or engineering field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Microsoft certification – Data Analyst Associate
  • Industry Knowledge of best practices learned from MVP & Product Team articles and Investments/Finance.
  • Training. Excited to support new Power BI users by running various internal community initiatives such as presentations, hands-on workshops, or troubleshooting end-user obstacles.
  • Demonstrated success building deep technical relationships and aligning expectations across various partners.
  • Problem-Solving. The ability to trace data lineage and resolve technical issues with minimal direction.
  • Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success.

Technical

  • A depth of Power BI experience wrangling complex data using M functions and developing sophisticated semantic logic using DAX expressions
  • Connect/Transform. Knows what “M” is, how to merge, append, and perform more advanced UI transforms
  • Model. Basic knowledge of dimension / fact tables and can identify them in a dimensional model. Comfortable with simple DAX, knows the CALCULATE function well and can explain how it works.
  • Visualization.  Recommends appropriate visualizations to answer business questions and references examples of published materials that explain how to choose a visual. Proficient at all ways to manipulate look & feel.
  • Admin/Architecture. Has experience configuring Administrative features in the tenant. Knows how to install and manage a gateway. Basic levels of understanding of licensing.
  • Embed/Custom Visuals. Understand that Power BI can be embedded internally and knows how to add and share in Teams.
  • Breadth of technical experience and knowledge in the MSFT data and analytics ecosystem, with Subject Matter Expertise in two or more of the following items:
    • Power BI Service administration
    • Power BI Desktop
    • Tabular Editor and DAX Studio
    • Azure Synapse Analytics
    • Azure Data Factory
    • Azure Machine Learning
    • Azure Databricks

Vaccination Policy
At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance.  Accordingly, employees are required to be fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption before attending OMERS and Oxford premises for work or for participating in in-person work events or work meetings.

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

item.title: Senior Data Engineer, Global Investments
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Senior Data Engineer, Global Investments Technology (GIT) will join a team that leads the delivery of the products and platforms that enable OMERS Global Investments (GI) to analyze opportunities, action investment decisions and optimize the OMERS investment portfolio. GIT works across investment teams including Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Private Equity, Growth Equity and Ventures, and in close collaboration with Finance, Risk & Compliance teams.

As a key member of the Global Investments Technology team, the Senior Data Engineer is instrumental in improving data & analytics capabilities by championing industry best practices and delivering data as a product to support investment decision making.



The Senior Data Engineer will operationalize and maintain data pipelines deployed to the OMERS investment entities and cultivate a business relationship that assists in meeting business demands. The individual must also support and collaborate with data analysts, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and integration as part of 1 or more product team(s).

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Technical

  • Translating requirements into solutions
  • Defining and executing technical test plans, performing unit, performance and integration tests and automating regression tests
  • Deploying ETL/ELT pipelines to achieve a high level of reliability, scalability and security
  • Sourcing, transforming and delivering structured and unstructured assets for analytical use
  • Optimizing performance of ETL pipelines and data sources
  • Participating in solution build, delivery, support and troubleshooting
  • Provisioning and managing Azure resources, including security and cost
  • Monitoring pipelines. Improving reliability. Automating audit

Organizational

  • Operating in an Agile development environment
  • Communicating effectively with other engineers and various other partners such as product managers, data & business analysts, IT infrastructure specialists, security specialists, enterprise architects and members of senior management
  • Leading change and communicating impacts to partners and fellow team members
  • Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for improving existing processes
  • Exhibiting the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensuring timely delivery
  • Participating in establishing sound data management practices for the team and the organization
  • helping shape and scale the future of our development and production infrastructure

Qualifications:

Professional

  • Experience. 5+ years solving sophisticated technical data projects using the Microsoft Azure data stack or equivalent work experience. Financial industry application is preferred.
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in a scientific or engineering field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Microsoft Data engineer associate level certificate will be considered as an asset
  • Industry Knowledge of best practices. Previous experience in developing and deploying operational procedures, tuning guides and best practices documentation
  • Relationship Building. Consistent track record of building deep technical relationships. Experience in aligning expectations across various partners
  • Problem-Solving. The ability to trace data lineage / workflows and resolve technical issues with minimal direction
  • Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success

Technical

  • Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, and technology management
  • Experience with data architecture, modeling, data warehousing
  • Breadth of technical experience and knowledge across the Azure Data Platform, with depth / Subject Matter Expertise in two or more of the following Data Platform resources:
    • Azure Data Factory
    • Azure Databricks, experience with Scala/Python/Spark
    • Azure Functions using C#, PowerShell or Python
    • Azure SQL Database or PostgreSQL
    • Azure Synapse Analytics
    • Azure Cosmos DB
    • Azure App Services
    • Azure Logic Apps
  • Proven experience automating CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or equivalent work experience
  • Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform is preferred
  • Experience with SQL Server Data Tools
  • Experience developing star schema reporting pipelines using Kimball or Data Vault v2.0 methodologies

Our story
Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging.

item.title: Senior Enterprise Data Architect
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

Reporting into the Director of Enterprise Architecture, the Senior Enterprise Data Architect strengthens the impact of, and provides recommendations on, business information that will need to be available and shared consistently across the organization through the identification, definition and analysis of how information assets aid strategies and business outcomes. The Senior Enterprise Data Architect is responsible for data management and governance, solution architecture for data projects, implementation of risk and controls for all initiatives.

You will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers and colleagues as genuine partners.

Commercial Real Estate is a $200 Trillion industry that is larger than the public equities and bond market combined, and yet is only just being disrupted by technology.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Influence information strategy: By partnering with business unit leadership, and through the rationalization of the information value chain, the information architect define, lead and communicate information and data management strategies and plans as well strategic recommendations to maximize the value of information assets via their creation, access and use.

Maximize value derived from data and analytics: Foster value creation using the organization\'s data assets, as well as the external data ecosystem. This includes aiding value creation through data exploitation, envisioning data-enabled strategies, as well as enabling all forms of business outcomes through analytics, data and analytics governance, and enterprise information policy.

Enhance decision making: Use tools such as business information models to provide the organization with a future-state view of the information landscape that is unencumbered by the specific data implementation details imposed by proprietary solutions or technologies. Assist decision design.

Conduct business information modeling: Create and manage business information models in all their forms, including conceptual models, relational database designs, message models and others.

Manage risk: Aid the definition of data classifications and data zoning to allow information assets to be immediately identified and proactively managed as more information becomes federated in a digital economy.

Secure data and analytic assets: Aid in the analysis of data and analytics security requirements and solutions ensuring compliance with controls and standards across all data initiatives.  

Improve EIM performance: Aid efforts to improve business performance through enterprise information solutions and capabilities, such as master data management (MDM), metadata management, analytics, content management, data integration, and related information management or information infrastructure components.

To succeed in this role, you have:

Education and Training

This role requires a bachelor\'s degree in computer science, information systems or a related study (or equivalent project-related experience).

Experience

  • A minimum of ten years of experience in IT, with at least seven years in information system design.
  • In-depth experience of designing and implementing information solutions.
  • Hands-on experience with implementing data management programs is preferred.
  • Five to seven years\' experience in enterprise data architecture is highly desirable.

Required Knowledge and Skills

  • Familiarity with information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, agile and lean methodologies, infrastructure and operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks.
  • Define and build enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions and associated documentation to strengthen data management
  • Develop capability and technology solutions around key data governance areas of data sharing, access management, data quality management, data lineage, metadata management and the data catalog, records management, information risk and controls. Automate data management processes and governance activities related to key governance areas
  • Data modeling and information classification expertise at the enterprise level.
  • Understanding of metamodels, taxonomies and ontologies, as well as of the challenges of applying structured techniques (data modeling) to less-structured sources.
  • Familiarity with data science concepts, as well as MDM, business intelligence, and data warehouse design and implementation techniques.
  • Experience with distributed management and analytics in cloud and hybrid environments. Also an understanding of a variety of data access and analytics approaches (for example, microservices and event-based architectures).
  • Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.
  • Strong communication and persuasion skills, including the ability to create marketing and messaging materials that meet stakeholder needs.

Key Behaviors and Competencies

  • Demonstrate the ability to work well with others and exhibit leadership.
  • Have a track record of remaining unbiased toward specific technologies or vendors.
  • Be an excellent communicator and collaborator, engaging with multiple technical and business stakeholders and leaders.
  • Be able to translate the information architecture contribution to business outcomes into simple briefings for use by various data-and-analytics-related roles.
  • Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations.
  • Ability to quickly comprehend the functions and capabilities of new technologies.
  • Display intellectual curiosity and integrity.

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.title: Lead Data Governance Specialist
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

The Lead Data Governance Specialist works as part of the Enterprise Data Governance Team to support the implementation of new data governance tools and related processes, with a focus on enterprise data cataloging, metadata management, business workflows and data quality management.

This role will work closely with the Business teams and other Data & Technology partners to ensure data governance standards, policies and best practices are understood and applied consistently across the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand OMERS business functions, activities, and transactions, as well as standard information and data governance best practices to contribute practical solutions for both structured and unstructured data in the development and implementation of the Data Governance Program

  • Design, develop and monitor technology solutions around key data governance focus areas of data catalog, metadata management, data quality management, data lineage business workflows and access management

  • Partner with Enterprise Data Governance Managers and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE’s, evolve our enterprise business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business definitions and the underlying technical metadata

  • Manage the processes around metadata repositories (data dictionary, business glossary) and data classification process (identification of sensitive data)

  • Perform data profiling, data quality analysis and the development of data quality rules to support monitoring and remediation activities

  • Refine and implement the enterprise metadata management framework, inclusive of business, operational and technical metadata

  • Provide ongoing access, maintenance, usage, and technical support for our Data Governance Tool inventory including Collibra, Azure Purview

  • Contribute to the development of reporting requirements to monitor data compliance as well as KPIs and metrics to gauge the health and maturity of data governance program

  • Collaborate with business and D&T partners to find opportunities to improve data accuracy and ensure that data owners are accountable for remediation

  • Contribute to the development of appropriate materials, conducting training sessions and be the change advocates to drive data governance best practices

  • Provide inputs on the design and development of data models for data warehousing and cataloging projects

  • Work closely with Data & Technology team during the development of new information and data governance related applications, including requirements validation and testing

  • Primary point of contact for business partners to resolve data security & access issues

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, math or a field related to information, data management, analytics or financial services.

  • 3 - 5 years of technical experience in implementing data governance, data analytics or data quality tools

  • Knowledge and expertise in data governance technology, business process modeling, metadata, data lineage, data classification, data quality and enterprise implementation of data governance tools and solutions

  • Experience in defining and building enterprise data management policies, processes, solutions, and associated documentation to strengthen data management

  • Experience with SQL, database applications MS SQL/ Oracle, and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau

  • Understanding of Cloud, Big Data technologies, architectural concepts - data lake, data warehouse, relational databases, data ingestion, ETL etc.

  • Hand’s on experience with tools such as Ataccama, Collibra, Informatica EIC/ BDM/BDQ, IBM IGC/ IA/ DQS, Microsoft Purview or similar

  • Knowledge and understanding of data regulations, privacy, ethical use, data sharing, critical data indicators, access management and data masking techniques

  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams

  • A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives. 

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance. Accordingly, employees are required to provide evidence of full vaccination or have an approved exemption.

item.description:

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. Why join us?

The Business Systems Analyst will join the dynamic Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics (DNA) team within Data & Technology. DNA applies data, analytics and AI to develop scalable and appropriately governed solutions that drive sustainable growth at OMERS. The Business Systems Analyst will work alongside members of the DNA team and partner with the business to design, develop, implement, and scale data solutions that follow our data governance requirements (Data Classification, Data Retention, etc.).

You will work closely with our business and technology teams to support implementation of DNA’s strategic objectives and where possible, you will also identify advanced methods to simplify and automate our solutions. You will develop and nurture strong relationships with key governance partners (including Cybersecurity, Risk, Privacy) and also those within a variety of different business units across our global portfolio,  to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.


As a member this team, you will be responsible for: 

  • Liaising between business and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document and validate requirements for Data and Advanced Analytics products and solutions 
  • Defining detailed solutions in the form of detailed technical specifications/approaches for DNA products  
  • Ensuring data governance controls such as classification, retention, and disposition are appropriately considered in our products and solutions 
  • Providing hands-on support and technical expertise for product and solution implementation (e.g., implementation of Microsoft Information Protection Sensitivity Labels, retention labels in Microsoft 365, etc.) 
  • Supporting user adoption via the development and delivery of training and enablement activities  
  • Supporting DNA’s goal to remain on the leading edge of emerging data, analytics and AI technologies and techniques by identifying industry innovations and related data risk and compliance challenges  

To succeed in this role, you have:  

  • A degree in Computer Science, Data, Technology, or Engineering (or related experience) 
  • 3-5 years of experience as a business systems analyst with an emphasis on the implementation of data analytics and governance solutions (e.g., Microsoft Information Protection, Records Retention Labeling/Policies in Microsoft 365, Collibra, Informatica, Power BI Dashboards, data warehouses) 
  • Demonstrated experience partnering with business stakeholders to elicit and document requirement for complex data analytics and governance products 
  • Strong understanding of Microsoft 365 (SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive) including experience gathering technical requirements and hands-on experience in these tools. Experience implementing Microsoft Information Protection and retention labels is highly desirable. 
  • Demonstrated experience in modernizing data analytics and governance solutions via process engineering, automation, and other leading-edge approaches 
  • Excellent verbal and written communication to effectively articulate and communicate with both business and technical development teams  
  • Independent and motivated working style with a passion for learning new things 
  • A team player with a good understanding of the Agile methodology and Change Management best practices
