item.title: Senior Manager, Portfolio Engineering
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers. 

At Oxford, our investment in building technology, a robust data pipeline and advanced analytics means that we are always improving, growing and doing things better. And as the Senior Manager, Portfolio Engineering, you will help make this happen!

As a technical expert in engineering and operations, you will provide strategic direction and tactical guidance on all operational matters within the portfolio. You will influence continuous improvement of regional engineering operations across the portfolio, development of tools for site teams and resources for consistent optimization, while supporting cost effective solutions, operational KPIs and customer comfort. Collaborating and working with colleagues you will be part of a team that leads innovation, efficiencies, and operational excellence across the portfolio.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Product Innovation and Optimization

  • Support strategic initiatives where there will/should be meaningful impact to operational excellence

  • Support site teams with technical guidance and programming recommendations, especially as it relates to smart/digital building technology

  • Act as primary liaison with local utilities, identifying saving and ROI opportunities

  • Liaising with our corporate Platform Services to provide input to regional initiatives and corporate programs

  • Collecting and analyzing data to improve performance and customer outcomes, and to support advancement of optimization opportunities

  • Identify opportunities with 3rd party contractors to deepen relationship to support economies of scale and optimum service delivery

  • Research new technical innovations from within and outside of real estate, and advance leading-edge programs that align with business priorities and present business cases to support any recommendations

  • Establish protocol(s) to maintain consistent and on-going data acquisition / reporting for industry designations

Capital Projects and Construction

  • Provide technical leadership and management for the review, bidding and successful completion of engineering & operational related capital projects or other cost reduction initiatives

  • In partnership with the Construction & Design team, act as a resource to site teams to ensure correct protocols and Oxford standards are met including tendering and RFP processes

  • Actively support sales and property management teams, as needed

Compliance and Administration

  • Responsible for developing and executing formal program(s) to ensure all properties comply with building/operational regulatory requirements

  • Assist investment team with due diligence, IE physical property assessment / review of existing documentation, analyze final reports and make recommendations

  • Identify and drive streamlining of permitting and access of 3rd party partners

To succeed in this role, you:

  • Have a minimum of 7 years of operational experience in a high-rise commercial real estate.

  •  5 + years of experience managing engineering staff. This includes strong employee relation skills, leadership skills, coaching skills and training skills.

  • Have Power Engineering certification and/or possess a post-secondary degree or diploma in building science, mechanical or electrical engineering.

  • Smart building technology experience is a must and LEED AP, Energy Management certification (CEM), Facility or Systems training such as FMA, SMA via BOMA would be an asset.

  • Have experience completing business cases to support senior management decisions and managing approved projects from end to end.

  • Are an expert in electrical and mechanical systems including HVAC and life safety systems, energy auditing, mechanical, electrical, building sciences, construction processes and business administration.

  • Possess superior analytical skills with the ability to analyze large volumes of data, find trends, and make recommendations on strategic and tactical direction on operational matters without compromising customer comfort.

  • Have experience with the RFP process.

  • Strong business acumen and knowledge of customer service/service excellence trends.

  • Outstanding troubleshooting and analytical thinking to resolve issues.

  • Excellent interpersonal skills: able to build relationships and collaborating at all levels, with proven negotiations skills.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

item.title: Senior Solution Architect
item.description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor?    If so, we would love to tell you our story.
 
At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe.  Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it!  We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

We are looking for a highly motivated and accomplished Solution Architect that is passionate about architecting scalable, secure and highly reliable solutions in a fast-paced agile environment. The Solution Architect will join our OMERS Corporate Business Relationship Management team in Toronto to engage, model and drive the organization to adopt leading practices, ensure strategic alignment between IT and Business, foster innovation and support business and IT strategies.


As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing innovative approaches to create new solutions that contribute to the achievement of the organization’s targets and delivery of business outcomes
  • Designing innovative solutions using native cloud resources, translating business requirements and use cases defined through the Intake process into dynamic infrastructure capabilities that evolve as business needs change and additional cloud services become available
  • Developing infrastructure-as-code and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to enable DevOps practices
  • Provide expert advice to teams on developing secure architectures, perform reviews, and document gaps while creating cloud security guidance & documentation
  • Defining architecture models and reusable solution design patterns that enable rapid deployment of cloud services for diverse business entities
  • Owning architectural responsibilities for all assigned project work, including stakeholder management, architecture requirements, analysis, business case development, budgeting, solution design, implementation planning, and deployment
  • Collaborating with stakeholders to gather functional and non-functional requirements for a specific project and facilitate trade-off discussions and resolution of conflicting requirements
  • Guiding, supporting and overseeing the implementation of documented solution architectures into operational platforms by engineering and operations teams
  • Incorporating security requirements into the design, understand and comply with OMERS security standards and policies
  • Providing direction and technical leadership in the adoption of new technologies and industry best practices
  • Developing and delivering strategic roadmaps to increase our cloud maturity, and provide subject matter expertise and governance as roadmaps are planned and executed
  • Building and communicating architecture plans, including future states and roadmaps, to all stakeholders including Business and Technology Leadership
  • Advising and supporting delivery teams on the use of patterns, capabilities, and complex technical issues
  • Influencing, negotiating and securing buy-in and understanding within the organization
  • Effectively and simply communicating complex concepts to business audiences
  • Reviewing functional and technical specifications to ensure the development of consistent solutions and minimization of technical debt
  • Creating internal and external partnerships to enable business success
  • Efficiently and diligently following OMERS technology governance processes to enable successful delivery of technology solutions
  • Ensuring that the solution architectures delivered by projects are fit for purpose and adhere to sound IT practices and to OMERS principles and standards
  • Researching and understanding industry trends and their applicability to support architectural plans and strategies for the enterprise
  • Supporting the Solution Architecture communities of practice
  • Mobilizing resources in the organization to create quick prototypes that demonstrate the art of the possible in the context of business needs


To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Minimum of 9+ years of progressive experience in the IT industry with strong knowledge of cloud architectures, deployment models (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS), various technology domains, application development practices and IT operations
  • 5+ years prior experience in a senior solution architect role, demonstrating the technical design and practical implementation of complex infrastructure solutions in an enterprise environment; financial sector experience is an asset
  • Excellent understanding and hands-on experience with Kubernetes, containerization, service mesh, cloud infrastructure and microservices architecture
  • Expert knowledge across technology architecture domains and practices; capable of driving end to end solution cycle from strategy to architecture to design & implementation
  • Experience with assessment, development, implementation, optimization, and documentation of a comprehensive and broad set of security technologies and processes (secure software development (Application Security), data protection, cryptography, key management, identity and access management (IAM), network security) within SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud environments
  • A post-secondary degree in Math, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar
  • Expertise in GCP cloud IaaS and PaaS design, implementation and support, including connectivity, security, networking and disaster recovery
  • Proven experience in adopting and transitioning to cloud technologies from existing architectures
  • Experience with data and analytics architecture to enable BI Reporting, Analytics and AI/ML use-cases
  • Expert knowledge of solution delivery and software development practices (esp. Agile/Scrum), application release and deployment, and automated testing, including source code control, build / package, environment configuration and monitoring
  • The ability to work well at a conceptual level, resolve ambiguity, and to drive concepts into workable and practical solutions to achieve a target state
  • The ability to effectively identify emerging technologies, trends, standards and products that have a strong potential to better enable OMERS’ business units
  • Experience facilitating sessions, helping participants reach decisions and accomplish goals
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to foster cross-team alignment
  • The ability to coach and support teams on architectural concepts and processes
  • The ability to lead and facilitate sessions
  • The ability to balance good enough architecture with actionable steps and targets
  • The ability to use verbal communication to disseminate complex concepts
  • The ability to write clear and succinct documents and to create engaging diagrams

Nice to have:

  • Certifications – Google Cloud Certified Professional Architect and/or Google Cloud Certified Associate Engineer, Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), Certified Systems Security Professional (CISSP), CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) and/or CKAD (Certified Kubernetes Application Developer), CCOAK (Confluent Certified Operator of Apache Kafka) and/or CCDAK (Confluent Certified Developer of Apache Kafka

Vaccination Policy

At OMERS and Oxford the office or worksite is our primary place of work. We are committed to providing work environments which promote the health, safety and well-being of all employees in accordance with public health regulation and guidance.  Accordingly, employees are required to be fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption before attending OMERS and Oxford premises for work or for participating in in-person work events or work meetings.

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $105 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2020. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate. 

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.
